sentence.Network_en: So many things are unsafe these days—milk, cranberry sauce, what have you.
sentence.Network_cn: 现如今很多食品都不安全——牛奶、蓝莓酱等等。

sentence.Network_en: Actually I prefer canned cranberry sauce.
sentence.Network_cn: 事实上我更喜欢罐装的蔓越橘酱.

sentence.Network_en: Turkey reminds me of cranberry sauce.
sentence.Network_cn: 火鸡让我想起蔓越橘酱.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (originally North American): from German Kranbeere or Low German kranebeere 'crane-berry'

entry.tran: (常用来制作调味料或果酱，并与荤菜一道食用的)越橘，小红莓
entry.def: Cranberries are red berries with a sour taste. They are often used to make a sauce or jelly that you eat with meat.

means.word_mean: 1. any of numerous shrubs of genus Vaccinium bearing cranberries
2. very tart red berry used for sauce or juice
